page.description: The list of form instances to edit or view.

description.p: The Forms List screen displays instances of forms. These are forms that are ready to be filled out, partially filled out, or completed but still available for viewing and perhaps modification.

The Forms List is, by default, listed in chronological order of creation. That is, the oldest forms will be displayed last. The list may optionally be sorted and filtered by form *[status]* and/or form *[type]*.

Each row in the list represents one instance of a particular type of form. The display name of that type of form is shown in large bold type. The icon associated with the form type will be shown on the left and the associated color background will be used for the row. The date/time when the form instance was first created will be shown above the display name. If there are any issues with the form (such as missing required fields or detected validation errors) a red [redStar] star will be displayed after the date/time. (Information about any issues is available when viewing the form details through a menu item.) A blue [blueDot] dot indicates that the form was changed in a recent Refresh from the server. The current status of the form (for example, "Open") will be displayed on the upper-right of the row.
Some types of forms display additional information below the display name, such as the value of certain form fields.
The left edge of the colored part of the row may optionally have a different color:

ul.li: Blue indicates a new form that has not been uploaded to the server.
Orange indicates a form with edit modifications that have not been uploaded to the server.
Red indicates a form which encountered errors when attempting synchronization with the server. Information about the errors is available when viewing the form details through a menu item.
Black indicates a form deleted on the device but not yet deleted on the server.

description.p: Tapping the row for a particular form will select it for viewing, editing, or deletion. Selection is shown as a slightly wider display on the row. After returning to the Forms List screen from viewing or editing a form, that form will remain selected in the list.
To view and optionally edit the contents of a form, do any one of the following:

item.name: *[Tap]* the form row to select, and then tap the *[Edit]* button at the top of the screen.
*[Double-tap]* the form row to both select and open for edit.
*[Press and hold]* on the form row to both select and open for edit.

description.p: See the [Form Details Screen] help for more information about viewing and editing a form.
There is a control bar at the top of the screen. It includes a [menu] Menu button and information described in the [Main Control Bar] help.

The [sort] Sort button displays a menu for specifying how the Forms List is ordered and and filtered. By default, all forms are listed in the order in which they were created, indicated by the *[Date]* item on the menu.
See the [Main Control Bar] help for more information about sorting and filtering.
To delete the selected form and all of its data, tap the [delete] Menu button and then tap the *[Delete Form]* menu item. Deleting a form requires confirmation. There is no "undelete".
See the [Main Control Bar] help for more information about deleting a form.

section.title: Existing Forms and Add Form tabs

description.p: Above the list there is an *[Existing Forms]* and an *[Add Form]* tab button to switch the display between a list of existing form instances and a list of the types of forms available for creating new form instances.
For information about adding form instances, see the [Add Form Help].
Above the list is information and buttons related to downloading and uploading form data from and to the server. For more information see the [Downloading, Refreshing, and Uploading].
